function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of valid and reliable tools for assessing participant outcomes related to green space exposure and contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Selection bias in the population","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusion bias in the selection of individuals providing data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Derivation of green space variable not well described","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"35 cohort studies and 69 cross-sectional studies, including 18 large scale ecological studies, may increase the risk of disease transmission due to the close contact and interactions among participants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assessments of quality were initially made by one reviewer and then cross-checked by another, potentially leading to discrepancies in identifying risks of disease transmission in the study environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close interactions and discussions during the consensus process for quality assessments may pose a risk of disease transmission among the individuals involved.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Small sample sizes in studies on forest bathing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Recent growth in interest in greenspace and health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Papers and documents not written in english","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variation in size of populations under investigation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Authors not presenting required data for meta-analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High heterogeneity in study populations, design, and exposure","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Studies with high risk of bias or low quality not excluded from sensitivity analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear definition of terms such as ’neighbourhood environment’ and ’built environment’ may lead to inconsistent inclusion or exclusion of studies related to contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate piloting of data extraction sheet may result in incomplete or inaccurate recording of study details, leading to potential data errors and bias in the synthesis and analysis.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Publication bias or selective reporting in meta-analysis may lead to an inaccurate estimation of the association between greenspace and contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of communicable diseases from the review may overlook the impact of greenspace on disease transmission and propagation.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of mental health from the review may neglect the potential mental health benefits of greenspace, impacting overall well-being and quality of life.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited scope may result in overlooking the impact of greenspace on certain health outcomes, leading to incomplete evidence for decision-making.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and education on disease prevention in greenspaces","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low-income neighborhoods have reduced greenspace availability, leading to lower use of greenspaces","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Park quality and frequency of park use are higher among high-socioeconomic status ses residents","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Living in a greener neighborhood is linked with stronger greenspace-health associations and lower income-related health inequalities","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration between health care providers and local nature partnerships","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty and temporary interventions in the housing sector due to the pandemic, leading to potential disruptions in the sharing economy and real estate market.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of support for digital transformation processes","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate integration of spatially blind policies and local ones","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration between real estate interests and social value in urban regeneration processes","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of healthcare trace and tracking in epidemiological management.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proximity economies and place-based perspective in economic development policies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of innovation in public policies for reusing and sharing commercial spaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity-based placemaking approach may lead to close contact and potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of hygiene and sanitation practices in public spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close proximity and interaction in public spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of guidance and planning in placemaking initiatives","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Members joining the cooperative voluntarily may introduce contagious diseases into the company’s environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordinated innovation in territorial development may hinder progress in local productivity structures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate promotion of alternative technologies with low environmental impact may lead to unsustainable development practices.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of feasibility studies and planning for the implementation of innovative projects may result in ineffective and unsustainable outcomes.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of profits for urban regeneration interventions may lead to unintended consequences such as displacing vulnerable communities or disrupting natural habitats, potentially affecting the well-being of the population.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity-based entrepreneurial innovations may lead to increased interaction and exposure among individuals, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Community-based organizations and energy policies may involve physical gatherings and interactions, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The creation of energy communities and collective energy projects may lead to increased physical interaction and social gatherings, posing a risk for disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy protection for individuals’ purchasing and movement data","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through crowded retail spaces and transport hubs","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of economic instability and disparity in neighborhoods due to post-pandemic contractions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient investment capacity for digital visibility","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Liquidity crisis due to pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of skills and tools for local market analysis","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
